intro: Aethusa mutellina, commonly known as the common cowbane, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and compound leaves with a serrated edge. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in fields and along roadsides. Due to its toxic properties, it is considered a noxious weed in many regions.
